data.title: Aerospace Supply Chain Management Services - Aircraft Parts Supplier
data.meta_description: FDH Aero: Your trusted aircraft parts distributor with over 60 years in the industry. Contact us today for premium aerospace supply chain management services!
data.text:
Heather Rosenow serves as the Vice President, Global Marketing & Communications for FDH Aero.

In her role, Heather is responsible for leading the global marketing strategy for FDH Aero including Brand Experience, Audience & Market Segmentation, Communications Strategies, Channel Optimization, Advertising Planning, Global Air & Trade Shows, Executive Briefing Programs, Digital Marketing, Content Development, Mergers & Acquisitions, Media & Public Relations, and Employee Engagement with the FDH Aero Brand.

Prior to joining FDH Aero, Heather served as Chief Marketing Officer for SaaS organization, TurnStyle, and as Head of Marketing & Brand at Bell Textron. She has also held executive leadership roles transforming marketing, strategy, and sales within the top-tier global experiential marketing agency space.

Heather is a results-oriented strategist, with over 28 years of experience in diverse industries and global markets, including considerable focus in Aerospace & Defense. She brings a reputation for driving pioneering & disruptive brand strategies that motivate employee & partner engagements and maintains a discerning eye on meaningful business outcomes.

Heather graduated Magna Cum Laude with a BA-Business Management from Saint Leo University.

Björn Anders serves as Managing Director – EMEA for FDH Aero.

In his role, Björn leads overall strategic direction while maintaining full P&L accountability. His responsibilities include supporting business development and partnership opportunities, ensuring strong governance and local compliance, and strengthening the company’s presence in the support of our regional customers.

Prior to joining FDH Aero, Björn spent 15 years at Incora (formerly Wesco Aircraft), leading regional sales, strategic accounts, product management, and corporate contracts, in Germany and France. During his tenure, he also served as General Manager for Incora’s German subsidiary and managed key restructuring initiatives. Before his time at Incora, Björn spent four years at Lisi Aerospace, where he served as Inside Sales & Contract Manager.

Björn earned a Diplom-Kaufmann (FH) from Hochschule Harz in Wernigerode, Germany.

Yael Bitton serves as Vice President, General Counsel for FDH Aero.

In her role, Yael is responsible for providing strategic legal guidance, overseeing global legal operations, and managing all legal affairs to support the organization’s business objectives. She reports to Matt Lacki, Chief Transformation Officer.

Prior to FDH, Yael served as Senior Corporate Counsel at Incora for three years. Before Incora, Yael served five years at KLX as a contracts lawyer, two years of which with Boeing Distribution Services.

Yael is a lawyer licensed in Florida, France and Israel. With strong experience in Aerospace & Defense, Yael actively collaborates with internal and external stakeholders across various functions and regions to support general legal matters, contract negotiations and regulatory oversight.

Yael earned a Juris Doctor, Cum Laude, in Commercial and Intellectual Property Law, from the University of Miami School of Law. She also graduated with a Master’s Degree in Private Law from the University of La Sorbonne in Paris, France.

Cody (Shaojie) Ho serves as Managing Director – APAC for FDH Aero.

In his role, Cody leads overall strategic direction while maintaining full P&L accountability for the Asia-Pacific region. His responsibilities include supporting business development and partnership opportunities, ensuring strong governance and local compliance, and strengthening the company’s presence in the support of our regional customers.

Prior to joining FDH Aero, Cody spent 11 years in senior leadership roles at Wesco Aircraft, in the Asia-Pacific region. Before his time at Wesco, Cody was a Purchasing Engineer at PCC.

Currently, Cody is finalizing his doctorate degree in Transaction Cost Economics. He has earned two master’s degrees, an MBA from The University of Hong Kong, and a Master of Science in Management Research from Kedge Business School. He has also earned a bachelor’s degree in Material Science and Engineering from Shanghai University.

Bob Loycano serves as the Vice President of Supply Chain for FDH Aero.

In his role, Bob is responsible for establishing the purchasing and planning strategies utilized by each of the FDH Aero businesses. He aggregates the collective’s purchasing synergies, enabling improved partnerships with suppliers.

Prior to joining FDH Aero, Bob spent seven years as Executive Director of Supply Chain at Wesco. After his time at Wesco, Bob spent 10 years as Vice President of Procurement at KLX Aerospace – three years of which were spent with Boeing Distribution Services, after its acquisition of KLX. During his tenure, Bob oversaw all global procurement, planning, sourcing, and technical support.

Bob’s experience extends well beyond aerospace distribution – starting his career as an engineer at General Electric Aircraft Engines. He then spent 18 years at Pratt & Whitney as a manufacturing & design engineer, and later, as Commodity Manager.

Bob graduated magna cum laude with a Bachelor of Science degree in Manufacturing Engineering from Oxford University. He would go on to earn an MBA from the University of Connecticut.

Jason Lewis serves as the Vice President, Quality for FDH Aero.

In his role, Jason is responsible for leading FDH Aero’s quality operation. Along with overseeing the quality and compliance process at FDH, Jason works closely with COO, Ryan Kinslow, to create quality reports and processes that allow for seamless transfer of products within FDH Aero businesses.

With 20+ years of quality and operations executive experience, Jason brings a wealth of operational knowledge to the team. Prior to FDH Aero, Jason spent 18 years at Boeing Global Services as Executive of Supply Chain Quality. There, he focused on streamlining operations to reduce operating costs and mutually improve profitability.

Formerly a committee member of both the FAA Suspected Unapproved Parts Committee and ASA Quality Assurance Committee, Jason currently sits on the Board of Directors for the Aviation Suppliers Association.

Jason graduated from The University of Miami with a BS in Engineering. He also earned an Airframe and Power Plant License from the Wentworth Institute of Technology, in Boston, MA.

Erin Waidelich serves as Vice President, OEM Sales for FDH Aero.

In her role, Erin leads all OEM commercial sales activities overseeing pipeline, maintaining and cultivating customer relationships, contract negotiations, and managing the inside sales team at the Center of Excellence, CA. She reports to Vice President, OEM Chad Gallentine.

Prior to her appointment as Vice President, OEM Sales, Erin served as Vice President of Aircraft Fasteners International, an FDH company. Erin has spent 12 years at FDH, holding various roles in supply chain and sales. Before her tenure with FDH, she spent five years at McMaster-Carr in Sales Operations.

Erin is a strategic and results-driven leader, with over 17 years of Global Supply Chain Management experience and a proven track record of maximizing growth and profits. Erin will continue to expand the breadth and depth of offerings to our OEM customers.

Solyman Omar serves as VP, Aftermarket – Americas.

In his role, Solyman serves as a key leader for all commercial sales activities overseeing pipeline development, internal sales pursuit process, proposal support, customer negotiations, contract closure, and managing the Aftermarket – Americas team. He reports to the EVP of Sales, Fred Short.

Prior to joining FDH Aero, Solyman served as the Chief Executive Officer of Jaco Aerospace, a leading technology-driven solutions provider for the civil and defense aerospace sectors. There, he led the distribution of all aerospace parts, chemicals, and expendable products for global aftermarket customers. Solyman has also held leadership roles at The Transdigm Group, Boeing Global Services, and Aviall.

With over 24 years of experience as an aerospace distribution and business executive, Solyman’s background in sales, program management, business development, leadership, and overall P&L accountability will continue to help drive value for FDH’s aftermarket customers and supplier partners. His leadership philosophy is to lead by motivating, inspiring, and creating long-lasting relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

Solyman earned a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration with Emphasis in Marketing from California State University, Northridge.

Paul Rice serves as Managing Director Aftermarket EMEA for FDH Aero.

In his role, Paul is responsible for overseeing all Aftermarket EMEA business, including Sales, Marketing, Operations, Quality and IT.

Prior to his appointment as Managing Director, Paul held the position of Vice President of Global Sales with PDQ Airspares, an FDH company.

Paul is a big picture thinker, collaborator, and true believer in the power of a team. This set of core ideals motivates and guides Paul in how he approaches leadership every single day. With 15 years of experience in the aerospace supply industry, and 30 combined years within the supply industry, he understands it takes a village and strives to make sure each employee within the organization adopts a similar mindset, understanding they play an integral role in the organization’s success.

Alice Zhang serves as Vice President, FDH Defense Aftermarket.

In her role, Alice serves as a key partner in leading our Military and Defense initiatives overseeing strategic customer relationships, business development, and all Military and Defense sales operations in the aftermarket sector.

Alice has spent 15 years in various senior leadership positions within the aerospace and defense industries. She joined FDH Aero during the acquisition of Unical Defense, where she served as Vice President, Sales. Prior to that she was Sales Director for Unical Aviation’s military division. She also spent 10 years at API where she served as Sales Director for APAC and FMS.

Alice graduated from ZheJiang University, in Hangzhou Zhejiang Province, a top-10 ranked university in China.
